title: Career and Technical Education Month, 2025
summary:
Proclamation 10893, issued by President Donald J. Trump on February 3, 2025, designates February 2025 as Career and Technical Education Month. The proclamation emphasizes the importance of a skilled workforce in driving America's economy and highlights the administration's commitment to enhancing career and technical education (CTE) opportunities. It reflects on past achievements, including the signing of the Strengthening Career and Technical Education for the 21st Century Act, which improved vocational training for millions of students.

Key implications include a focus on preparing students and workers for high-wage careers, particularly in science, technology, and engineering, while ensuring that technological advancements benefit Americans. The administration aims to provide accessible, high-quality training to empower the workforce, promote economic growth, and reinforce the notion that hard work leads to success. The proclamation celebrates American workers and their contributions to the nation's progress, advocating for a culture that prioritizes workforce development and skill acquisition for the 21st century economy.
